com.stoyanr.mastermind

Class ExpectedSizeAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stoyanr.mastermind.AbstractAlgorithm
      • com.stoyanr.mastermind.ExpectedSizeAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Algorithm

    public class ExpectedSizeAlgorithm
extends AbstractAlgorithm
    An implementation of the "expected size" Mastermind strategy. This strategy attempts to minimize the number of questions by always asking the question for which the "expected size" (the sum of all sizes multiplied by their probability) of combinations that yield any given answer is minimal.

    This strategy is described in details in the paper Yet Another Mastermind Strategy by Barteld Kooi.

    Author:
    Stoyan Rachev

    • Method Detail

      • calculateGuessRating

        protected final double calculateGuessRating(String guess)
        Description copied from class: AbstractAlgorithm
        Calculates a rating for the passed guess. The calculated rating should be a double value greater or equal to 0. Usually, the guess with the highest rating is the guess eventually returned by AbstractAlgorithm.makeGuess().
        Specified by:
        calculateGuessRating in class AbstractAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        guess - The guess for which a rating should be calculated.
        Returns:
        The rating calculated for the passed guess.
